doc.after: Education began in the earliest prehistory as adults trained the young in the knowledge and skills deemed necessary in their society In pre literate societies this was achieved orally and through imitation Story telling passed knowledge values and skills from one generation to the next As cultures began to extend their knowledge beyond skills that could be readily learned through imitation formal education developed Schools existed in Egypt at the time of the Middle Kingdom 4
